column1: * 1896 - J.R.R. Tolkien dictates Letter to Arthur Tolkien.
* 1914 - Translator Britt G. Hallqvist is born.
* 1938 - J.R.R. Tolkien gives an invitational speech at the Lovelace Society
column2: the essay club of wikipedia:Worcester College
column3: Oxford He reads them The Legend of Worming Hall
column4: a story that would become Farmer Giles of Ham.

column1: * 1977 - The Mythology of Middle-earth is published.
* 2008 - The Lord of the Rings Online: The Lord of the Rings Online: Shadows of Angmar
column2: "The Ashen Wastes" is released in Europe.

column1: In editions prior to the The Lord of the Rings (50th Anniversary Edition)
column2: the Appendix B mentions two events on this day in : Gandalf returning to life
column3: and the Mirror of Galadriel-sequence. Since it is clear from the narrative that the latter event occurred one day before departure on 16 February
column4: this causes a problem in the chronology. Wayne G. Hammond and Christina Scull decided to fix the Tale of Years so that the Mirror of Galadriel-sequence happened on 15 February. The return to life of Gandalf was also moved to this date
